Combo Formula
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher DS Archive (DS): Japanese DS Games Archive: Monster Farm DS 2: Misc. QA (post all new topics here, well make more sections later) : Combo Formula
By Thorr on Thursday, September 18, 2008 - 06:22 am:

I am working on the exact combo formula now. this is a work in progress but here is the start (I will continually refine this as I get better understanding) -
New Monsters Stats = (New Monster type's Base Stats) x (Loyalty Factor) + (Combined Monster's Inherited Stats) x (Compatibility Factor)


New Monster type's Base Stats = Book values of the monster you are creating

Loyalty Factor = If either monster has low loyalty, there will be a penalty. (In other words, they both have to be high in order to maintain their base stats)

Combined inherited stats = Average of the stats of the two monsters. This average changes according to how you arrange the main and sub breeds. For best results, use the main breeds of each monster as the new monster's main and sub breeds.

Compatibility Factor = 1 + 2 + 3 + 4 + 5
1) Breed compatibility bonus

2) Loyalty factor -
Bonus - Both are top level
Penalty - both are lowest level

3) Sensitivity Factor
Bonus - Both are High
Penalty - Both are Low

4) Leniency Factor -
Bonus - If both are Sweet not Spoiled
Penalty - If one of the monsters is Spoiled or Abused

5) Weight Factor -
Bonus - If both are muscular, but not fat
Penalty - if either is Fat or Skinny


It looks like Age and Rank are not factors. However, the paragraph above the formula in the guide says something about 'D rank' in the last sentence.

One question. Why are there two loyalty penalties?

By Thorr on Thursday, September 18, 2008 - 09:46 am:

I haven't received my book yet. I am doing this using the scans you sent me.


The loyalty factors are both slightly different.
The first loyalty factor is a direct modification of the base stats and looks at the total loyalty of both monsters. The lower the total, the lower the base stats from the book level.
The second loyalty factor is single bonus/penalty on the bonus portion. If both are very high, you will get a bonus. You will only get a penalty if they are both very low.

So, you want your loylaty high in order to establish your maximum Base. If the two monsters are high enough, you will garner a bonus too.
